This game has ruined itself with hindering itself. They could add a kernel-level anti-cheat but they are adamant on the fact that their AI anti-cheat will at some point surpass the cheats. How many more months do we have to play against people with cheats? It also doesn't help that they manually give suspensions to some experience boosters that have different colored medals. These medals are obtained by automation and in the end doesn't ruin the competitive experience of the game whatsoever. They could easily fix this by increasing the amount of experience you can gain from playing the game, making service medals of the highest tier easier to obtain, instead, the game punishes you by reducing your experience by playing more.

The griefing cooldown system is completely broken. If you have received an infraction and the next game you play you get reported for griefing, you will get suspended for another x amount of days, it inhuman amount of games without reports to reduce the level of your cooldowns and for the days to go down. This becomes increasingly problematic when an old player plays the game and new players think he cheats just because he is playing on an account that doesnt have colorful yearly medals to show off the fact that he has played the game for long. Griefing cooldowns were a mistake and not adding a kernel level anti-cheat is also a big mistake . Its a sad state for the game and only way to play the game properly is to play third-party-services like FACEIT. I expect better in the future.

According to Steam I've played this game for 6 hours... It has never once opened so I really don't what to say other than Fix it! I've tried many methods with no success. Apparently this is a known issue however there is not much in way of support available.

What can I say, the gameplay is one of the best of any mmo I've ever played, it's a ton of fun, and the depth of combos are fun to learn.  A lot of beautiful dungeons to explore, the raids are a ton of fun and getting better gear feels really good.

That is, it would feel good if it didn't feel so shit.  The 5% chance of getting leveling a weapon up after grinding all day only to be set back and there's NOTHING you can do but wait till tomorrow to try again feels shit.  It makes the game take much longer, I get it, it pads out the content to keep players whittling away until more content comes out, but it sucks, no other way about it.  I put up with it as long as I did because the gameplay, dungeons and raids are top notch and a ton of fun.  But I can only spend 4 hours a day doing the same exact grind over and over again before I burn out. Not even gonna cover how you can just pay hundreds or thousands of dollars to just speed up the gear grind like some dogwater mobile game.

Only play this game if you want to make an mmo your after work part time job.  I want to recommend the game, and it is free so try it out maybe you'll like it but its just too much for me.
if you have been playing its good. if your new tough shit get lost

To begin with, I love this game. The combat is the best I've experienced - beautiful, smooth, and satisfying. Visually the game is stunning. The story is not bad either. In the end, I think that there is no other game that engages me like this one.
However, as with every game after some time, it just gets boring but still, you may want to come back after a few months or even years. In this case, it is impossible. 
My main character has gear level 1400 so it is mid-game and I cannot find any party to do raids or dungeons etc. It is basically a scam, there is no way that over 30 thousand people are playing because there is no one doing any end-game content. Yes, you can find more probably a party when your gear level is 1600 but I could not even reach it because there is no one to play with. You have to complete dungeons or raids to gain resources needed for the update of your gear but how can you do it if there is no one to defeat a boss with you, being even worse when you play support. Gatekeeping is from another planet. I've never seen such discouragement from others, even though the community has shrunk so much still they will not want to waste time on you. Chat is dead, early regions are empty and even the main cities are quiet with characters staying still for hours. 
I love this game and I could have not been more disappointed after coming back after a year and seeing such a regression which makes a game unplayable. It is only worth playing if you are over 1600 gear but still, it is a challenge to find a party. Such a pity to see a game that took me hours stepping so low and not implementing any new changes to make it more new player-friendly or less p2w.
For now game looks dead and is quite unplayable.
Thanks for my guildmates for not gatekeeping my @ss

This game is fun for the most part (zombies) but when it's constantly deleting hard earned items crashing the game at important parts and telling you that it's your fault so you in turn lose more items. It makes the game take so long to progress with this and when you do progress finally, every blueprint/schematic/recipe you get, after crafting one, it puts it on a timer. (which isn't too bad) The bad part about this is that a good few of those b/s/r's you have are put of timers for 3 hours to 2 days of waiting. This brings me to my third problem with this game. For it being a looting shooter game, you are only allow 10 stash spots to save for later, so even if you craft what you can when you can, like the 2 day wait ones, you're only allowed those ten spaces and nothing else. 

TL;DR : The makers of this game were rushed or they rushed this game out themselves without even finishing it. A game will have a few bugs or glitches but when it is to the point of unplayable then its not finished. It should have been play-tested a lot more with more people and a higher priority on patching the game with frequent updates.

I've been playing Warframe since Gauss update, which is around 2019 or so. Awesome fast paced looter shooter game.

I don't usually play third person shooter games with photo-realistic design like these, but this one is an exception. The Warframe designs which are like bio mechas are amazing, the gameplay is really fun, and it's not just about the guns, it also have melees and warframes abilities, which combines into unique builds. You can also change your warframes functionalities like strength, durations and range with mods and such. The cinematic stories are phenomenal and I still praise them till this day. The game also has a lot of game modes, which we will also come to this later. The game also has amazingly friendly comunity as well. This game is FREE TO PLAY while having AAA game level of designs, and you can grind premium currency ingame pretty easily.

HOWEVER the game is quite grindy, which is the least worst thing on the list.
You want to play with new stuffs NOW, but you have to wait 3 days for it to finish crafting, which kills off the hype.
Every content updates brings you new game modes, which is another content island that has barely anything to do with the rest of the game, with materials that once you have everything you can craft with that materials will, with no doubt, never want to have anything to do with that game mode ever again. Although a lot of content updates adds a lot of refreshing new game modes and well, contents, they all feel so different that it feels like another game entirely. Every time.
The game also lacks a form of "endgame content". By that I don't mean sitting in Survival for 2 hours killing level 9999 foot soldiers. By that I mean actual hard bosses. Assassinate missions are a joke, the bosses are forgettable, save for Eidolons, Orbs and Ropalolyst, which are not available for majority of the player unless they grind really hard to unlock them, not to mention actually be able to beat them. Railjacks are fun for the first hour or so, but it's also another content island which you don't want to have anything to do with. Asides from those, Liches and Sisters hunts are actually quite fun, challenging and memorable as a boss, and does give some nice uses or Raijacks as their dramatic final confrontation. The new Orowyrm in Duviri Paradox is also quite something too, but wayy too easy.
I stopped playing Warframe around The New War, but it's still fun enough to keep me coming back to the game occasionally because of the fun gameplay, the mechanics deep under it keeps pushing me away, and every updates with new game modes keep getting me dumbfounded of what is going on and what to do every time I return.

TLDR: very fun game with fun gameplay, but once you look deeper, you will see a mess behind the mechanics.

1990s Flash game graphics meets platform fighter that takes the fun out of platform fighters.  

Characters aren't really that unique as it is all about weapons.  A "character" is a combination of weapons shared across a ton of the cast, and diff stats, and some "signature moves" which are abused by lower rank players and higher rank players use them rarely.   The characters lack personality or flair, and seem to just be references to something that already exists or skinned as a crossover and seems very lazy.

No blocking/shielding of any kind so gameplay turns into lots just pressing buttons, but don't worry, it's hard to punish it most the time so it's just how the game is played, in fact if you can bait people to try to punish you it's your advantage.

The game has nothing to reward fighting, so you just move around trying to bait each other into a something predictable.  Prediction and just trying stuff are the main aspects of this game, which make it flat and uninteresting compared to the pre-emptive, reactive and hitting waiting/unreactive 3 structure of traditional fighting games.

Jumps are super floaty.  Dodge is the ONE defensive mechanic of the game and there's constant RPS is built around "dodge or not".

Constant shoe ins to whatever crossover they can get.  So you can't even tell what character you're playing against by visuals half the time.  

Keeps some of the annoying aspects of platform fighters like edge guarding which if you're not a fan of that, then it also has weapon guarding just in case you didn't get enough guarding.  

Fun if you like to just chill and swing at people I guess.  For me though, playing it I feel my soul leaving my body looking for something else to do.  

I would have eliminated it from my list of games to ever play on the lazy art direction alone but got roped into trying it for almost 18 hours due to other people wanting me to try it.  I'm not sure how a game surviving off selling cosmetics has worked so long for them with a game this ugly.  I can't even tell if something is a leg, foot, or part of someones armor at times.  Where is their waist?  Do they have knees or ankles?  The world may never know.  The animations are jank too, and look done by SPINE or something else low budget.

Once upon a time in the quaint town of Pixelville, there lived a man named Donald Wallpaper. Donald was an ordinary guy with an extraordinary passion for wallpapers. His love for vibrant, artistic backgrounds knew no bounds, and he spent his days scouring the internet for the most unique and breathtaking wallpapers.

One day, as Donald was browsing a mysterious website known as "Walltopia," he stumbled upon a hidden portal that transported him to a world filled with living, breathing wallpapers. To his surprise, these wallpapers were not only visually stunning but also possessed unique abilities.

As Donald explored this new realm, he discovered that an evil force, known as the Monochrome Legion, sought to drain the colors and life from all the wallpapers, turning them into dull, lifeless images. Determined to save his newfound friends, Donald Wallpaper decided to take up the mantle of the Wallpaper Guardian.

Armed with a magical wallpaper wand and accompanied by his trusty sidekick, Pixel, a pixelated cat with the ability to transform into any wallpaper pattern, Donald set out on a colorful quest to defeat the Monochrome Legion.

His journey took him through surreal landscapes and challenging puzzles, where he encountered wallpapers of all shapes and sizes, each with its own special power. Some could manipulate time, while others controlled the elements. Donald learned to harness the abilities of these living wallpapers, turning them into powerful allies in his quest.

As he delved deeper into the Monochrome Legion's lair, Donald faced increasingly formidable enemies. The leader of the legion, a sinister figure known as Grayscale the Conqueror, proved to be a formidable adversary. Grayscale could drain the color from any living wallpaper with a mere touch, leaving a trail of desaturation in his wake.

In a climactic battle between Donald Wallpaper and Grayscale, the fate of Walltopia hung in the balance. The two clashed in a dazzling display of colors and magic, with Pixel lending his unique abilities to turn the tide of the battle. In the end, Donald's unwavering determination and love for wallpapers prevailed. He defeated Grayscale and restored vibrancy to the entire realm.

With the Monochrome Legion defeated, Donald Wallpaper became a legend in Walltopia. The living wallpapers celebrated their freedom, and Donald, having fulfilled his quest, returned to Pixelville with Pixel by his side.

Back in his own world, Donald continued his love for wallpapers, now with a deeper appreciation for their magical qualities. He shared his incredible adventure with the people of Pixelville, inspiring others to cherish the beauty and magic hidden within the digital canvases that adorned their screens. And so, the tale of Donald Wallpaper, the Wallpaper Guardian, became a timeless story of color, courage, and the magic that can be found in the most unexpected places.

-Pros-
+No P2W aspect.

-Cons-

-Steam Client's download time is horrific. 


Play it. You won't regret it.

Do not recommended if you are solo player or don't like to grind.
For a new player (especially for killer sided), this game is a nightmare waiting to be unleash on an unexpected soul. 

The amount of grind you have to endure is insane, even though they changed it to be much easier but it will be quite a grind to do if you want to unlock those perks you want to use. Starter perks/characters for survivors are decent but for killer is pretty much garbage (there are some good perks but pretty limited).

Most characters are lock behind paid-wall but you can get it quite cheap if you wait for those discounts or you can grind to unlock but it's not really worth the time.

The game experience is really random, you can get a good game with funny moments but it also make you question your own insanity and anger issue sometimes. DO NOT PLAY THIS GAME SOLO IF YOU WANT TO HAVE FUN (it might be fun for you but for me is a big no-no).

If you really invested your time and money on this game it might be a fun game with friends but for solo player that just want to find a new online PVP it might not be your cup of tea.
this game is ass cheeks

This was a fun game even before Overwatch's... decline, but now that the once-vaunted king of hero shooters has irrevocably proven itself to be one of the most legendarily mishandled projects in the medium, it seems it's time for Paladins to really shine. Yes, it's a bit janky -- there can be crashes and visual bugs - but frankly it feels like a welcome return to genre classics, a candy-colored arena shooter with character that aren't even trying to look like they wouldn't be at home doodled in the margins of various teenagers' notebooks. I don't much care for its ranked mode, but then again, I don't much care for ANY ranked mode, because my idea of a good time does not involve listening to grown men bicker with one another. I will say that while it's fine and dandy that the majority of these little loot box items can be directly bought, I feel as though the actual prices are a bit high for what you're getting. Something closer to the standard league of legends monetization model (yes, I know, ptooey ptooey, throw salt over your shoulders now) seems like it would be a better move for the company.

The perk shop in game gives this game even more depth, while not being able to change characters mid game you build around the other teams weaknesses within the shop similar to smite. Has TONS of Champions to chose from, only issue is the cosmetics and stuff kinda a rip off for most things in there but as a player since 2016 where I paid 20 bucks for the current Champions and ANY future Champions to release Ive seen this game come a very long way. and till this day ofc it needs balance changes here and there but its near a perfect experience as a team shooter very rewarding to win in this game in comparison to some others.

Timeless Excellence in Competitive FPS.
Review:
After spending 9.4 hours diving into the heart of Counter-Strike, it's clear why this game has stood the test of time as a pinnacle of competitive first-person shooters.

Likes:
Pure Competitive Thrill: Counter-Strike's focus on raw, competitive gameplay sets it apart. Every match feels like a high-stakes tactical chess game, requiring teamwork, strategy, and quick reflexes.

Iconic Maps: The classic maps like de_dust2 and cs_office remain not only nostalgic but also brilliantly designed. The familiarity breeds intense engagements and strategic plays.

Skill-Based Gunplay: The skill ceiling for gunplay is high, rewarding precision and mastery of weapon mechanics. The satisfaction of landing a precise shot or executing a well-timed strategy is unparalleled.

Dislikes:
Graphical Outdatedness: As expected from a game with such a rich history, the graphics are showing their age. An update to the visual presentation could enhance the overall gaming experience.

Learning Curve: For new players, Counter-Strike can be intimidating due to its steep learning curve. A more robust tutorial system could ease the entry for those new to the game.

Recommendation:
Counter-Strike remains an absolute must-play for anyone who appreciates the essence of competitive gaming. The adrenaline, the camaraderie, and the satisfaction of a well-executed plan make it a timeless masterpiece. While it may not cater to everyone due to its learning curve, those who embrace the challenge will find an FPS experience like no other.

I love this game! Different unit types to upgrade. Gaining rank gives you more opportunities to lead a squad by issuing commands. Upgrade weapons, tanks, planes, and personnel. Join in the war and deploy your own units to different cities in Europe. Too much to explain but so much fun learning how everything works.

Having enough fun with the game that I'd recommend.  Provided that you have good internet service/connection and seems to require faster processor or video card than expected for a game with such relatively simple graphics.  In that regard, it's a bit disappointing.  This happens after you start playing more involved battles with more "live" players.  So, in the beginning the game runs fine with low numbers of players but more AIs.  Game has nice reward features as you progress your soldiers.

It's a fairly good game considering it's free. The graphics, gunplay, etc I would say are all exceptional for a free game, however, since it's a free game it uses a currency that can be purchased by the player (or earned at a very slow rate). Since it is possible to pretty much buy everything with this currency, this obviously factors into the pay to win structure of the game. Aside from that this game provides a decent amount of entertainment, but gets very boring very quickly and has long wait times for matches with certain troop classes such as pilot or recon. It is a long while since a game has got me hooked like World of Warships (WOW) has.   

Apart from premium ships, there are many ships to research for free - you start out with access to four tier 1 cruisers and they play very well at early levels. The daily login rewards, battle experience, campaigns, etc. build up quite quickly.   

Certain battles are quite challenging. Playing against bots in co-op battles is easiest, where you can achieve c.98% success in winning battles - by comparison, random battles against players are tougher, where you might achieve c.50% success. Brawls and ranked battles make it even more challenging to increase your skill level. 

There seems to be a general rush to get to higher level ships but don't overlook the lower tier ships. Each ship plays a bit differently, with its own strengths and weaknesses - part of the fun is learning to handle them   and use them well tactically. The WOW official YouTube channel is useful for seeing how to vary play styles for destroyers, cruisers, battleships, etc.

I am loving the customisation (albeit most are paid features), with special commanders with voice overs, permanent camouflages / ship makeovers, and seasonal themes - these all add a role play experience (one of my recent favourites was the Heroes of Might and Magic 3 theme, which brought in some nostalgia as someone who has played that series).

One feature that is a bit limiting as a Steam player is that you cannot access the wider WOW community through a  Wargames.Net account - it would be great if there was a route for Steam players to access more of the community-developed content.

A long, long time ago, this game used to be fun. Since Epic's Takeover quality's been dropping consistently. Most changes to the game aren't made with the players or community in mind (Trading removal, the long awaited racing mode coming in an entirely different game to boost said other game's player numbers...).

The Servers are memed on for good reason, too. In a lot of games you get surprised when the server registers the opponents hit on the ball late or it happens to you, throwing you off. Competitive Matchmaking is terrible. Don't think any other game allows for such easy boosting as Rocket League does, especially in 2s. Gold 3s and Plats can queue with Champs apparently and since a single very skilled player can usually 2v1 less skilled players, you can have a fun time getting yourself carried to high diamond / low champ without even knowing how to hit the ball.

gameName: 鬼谷八荒 Tale of Immortal
name: 鬼谷八荒 Tale of Immortal

reviews.review:
Normally I dont like just putting blanket positive reviews, but the game is being review bombed for bug that for sure happened. Was fixed, but still shows terrible ratings now for a game that has a lot of effort put into it. I enjoy the game, hadn't started it in awhile loaded it and it loads fine. There is a post in discussions that states some fixes and hints mods could cause extending issues. 

Beyond that the game is great for the kind of game that it is. If you are familiar with and enjoy cultivation and the combat style detailed in the video appeals to you, then you will more than likely enjoy the game. It is one of the few that the combat isn't turned based of this style of grinding game.
The game wont start, do not buy.

If you can't launch the game try deleting version.dll in the game folder!

Great fun game to play atleast if you are already accustomed to wuxia/xianxia, meeting an immortal master that favors you is an amazing experience
Cannot start ?
This game is a ton of fun. It reminds me of those vampire survivors-like games, but Chinese.

I guess I have to start the review with this: the game launches fine. There are two solutions I know of if it doesn't, either will work, and both are explained in the community section for the game. Neither takes more than a minute to do, although deleting a .dll file from the game folder is by far the fastest method.

That aside, it's a fun sandbox. You get story quests and side quests and you basically just do your best to keep improving and advancing through the world. Focus on cultivating alone, join a sect and become the leader, give up on making progress to persuade every cultivator you meet to adopt you, or get your teeth kicked in by people significantly stronger than you because you weren't paying attention when you killed someone and now their entire family hates your guts. You can do it all. 

There are a bunch of different types of attacks and abilities you can equip, don't be afraid to try things out on the same character because there's no downsides to being stronger.

There are so many complex systems in the game, so many ways to build the character and so much to do, I found the overall experience extremely enjoyable. Grinding can be bothersome but there are ways to make it less tedious.

It's fun to play but it's a grindy, unpolished mess. It was also originally developed for a Chinese audience and the English translation is borderline garbage closer to the end of the game. Long story short, I will keep playing it but never recommend it to any of my friends or anyone I know.
